info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 4 at 5:50PM PDT until September 4 at 6:48PM PDT by NWS San Diego CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego.
* WHEN...Until 648 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 550 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Borrego Springs, Hwy S22 Between Ranchita And Borrego Springs, Ranchita, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78 and Shelter Valley. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 648 PM PDT THIS EVENING
